facelet-taglib.description: The Liferay Faces Alloy facelet component tags with the aui: tag name prefix.

function.description: Returns an escaped representation of the specified client ID.

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: If `true`, the list will remain visible even when there are no results to display.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: alwaysShowList

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: autocompletelistBodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: If `true`, keyboard navigation will wrap around to the opposite end of the list when navigating past the first or last item.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: circular

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
attribute.name: hideOn

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.
attribute.name: focusOn

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
attribute.name: hideOn

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.name: diagramnodeBodyContent

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: diagramnodeendBodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.name: diagramnodetaskBodyContent

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description:
Determine the content of Modal's body section.
Temporary fix for widget-stdmod bug when bodyContent initializes empty. this._currFillNode is never updated if _uiSetFillHeight is not called.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: hsvapalettemodalBodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.
attribute.name: focusOn

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
attribute.name: hideOn

attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: If true the slide show will be played when the ImageGallery is displayed.
attribute.name: autoPlay

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: The element to be used as caption.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: captionEl

attribute.description: If true the caption will be pulled from the title DOM attribute.
attribute.name: captionFromTitle

attribute.description: If true the Overlay with the image will be positioned on the center of the viewport.
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The element to be used as close.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: closeEl

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: The element to be used as left control.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: controlLeftEl

attribute.description: The element to be used as right control.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: controlRightEl

attribute.description: Delay in milliseconds to change to the next image.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"7000"}-->
attribute.name: delay

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.
attribute.name: focusOn

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: Image node element used to load the images.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: image

attribute.description: Configuration attributes passed to the Anim class.
attribute.name: imageAnim

attribute.description: The element to be used as info.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: infoEl

attribute.description: String template used to display the information.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"Image {current} of {total}"}-->
attribute.name: infoTemplate

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: The element to be used as loading.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: loadingEl

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: imagegalleryLocale

attribute.description: Returns a Y.Node instance of the node being used as the mask.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: maskNode

attribute.description: Displays the modal the viewport. Set to false to disable.
attribute.name: modal

attribute.description: Pagination configuration Object. The Pagination handles the thumbnails control.
attribute.name: pagination

attribute.description: Label to display when the slide show is paused.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description: Label to display when the slide show is playing.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"(Playing)"}-->
attribute.name: playingLabel

attribute.description: Preload all images grabbed from the links attribute.
attribute.name: preloadAllImages

attribute.description: If set to true, and WidgetPositionAlign is also added to the Widget, constrained positioning will attempt to prevent the widget's bounding box from overlapping the element to which it has been aligned, by flipping the orientation of the alignment for corner based alignments<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: preventOverlap

attribute.name: repeat

attribute.name: shim

attribute.description: Show the player controls (i.e., pause and show buttons).<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: showPlayer

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->

attribute.description: Toolbar with a play, and pause buttons.
attribute.name: toolbar

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: popoverBodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: The node to constrain the widget's bounding box to, when setting xy. Can also be set to true, to constrain to the viewport.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: constrain

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes and events that will trigger a re-focus back on the widget. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

By default, this attribute consists of two objects which will cause the widget to re-focus if anything outside the widget is clicked on or focussed upon.
attribute.name: focusOn

attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: headerContent

attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
attribute.name: hideOn

Controls whether `addRow`, `removeRow`, and `modifyRow` should trigger the underlying Model's sync layer by default.
When `true`, it is unnecessary to pass the "sync" configuration property to those methods to trigger per-operation sync.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"`false`"}-->

attribute.description: Configuration object passed to the class constructor in `bodyView` during render.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.description:
If the View class assigned to the DataTable's `view` attribute supports it, this class will be used for rendering the contents of the `<tbody>` including all data rows.
Similar to `view`, the instance of this View will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `body` property.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: bodyView

attribute.description:
The collection of data records to display. This attribute is a pass through to a `data` property, which is a ModelList instance.
If this attribute is passed a ModelList or subclass, it will be assigned to the property directly. If an array of objects is passed, a new ModelList will be created using the configured `recordType` as its `model` property and seeded with the array.
Retrieving this attribute will return the ModelList stored in the `data` property.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"`new ModelList()`"}-->
attribute.name: data

attribute.name: propertylistLocale

attribute.description:
Model subclass to use as the `model` for the ModelList stored in the `data` attribute.
If not provided, it will try really hard to figure out what to use. The following attempts will be made to set a default value:
1. If the `data` attribute is set with a ModelList instance and its `model` property is set, that will be used. 2. If the `data` attribute is set with a ModelList instance, and its `model` property is unset, but it is populated, the `ATTRS` of the `constructor of the first item will be used. 3. If the `data` attribute is set with a non-empty array, a Model subclass will be generated using the keys of the first item as its `ATTRS` (see the `_createRecordClass` method). 4. If the `columns` attribute is set, a Model subclass will be generated using the columns defined with a `key`. This is least desirable because columns can be duplicated or nested in a way that's not parsable. 5. If neither `data` nor `columns` is set or populated, a change event subscriber will listen for the first to be changed and try all over again.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"(see description)"}-->
attribute.name: recordType

attribute.description:
Deprecated as of 3.5.0. Passes through to the `data` attribute.
WARNING: `get('recordset')` will NOT return a Recordset instance as of 3.5.0. This is a break in backward compatibility.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: recordset

attribute.description: Enables the display of messages in the table. Setting this to false will prevent the message Node from being created and `showMessage` from doing anything.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: showMessages

attribute.description:
The current sort configuration to maintain in the data.
Accepts column `key` strings or objects with a single property, the column `key`, with a value of 1, -1, "asc", or "desc". E.g. `{ username: 'asc' }`. String values are assumed to be ascending.
Example values would be:
* `"username"` - sort by the data's `username` field or the `key` associated to a column with that `name`. * `{ username: "desc" }` - sort by `username` in descending order. Alternately, use values "asc", 1 (same as "asc"), or -1 (same as "desc"). * `["lastName", "firstName"]` - ascending sort by `lastName`, but for records with the same `lastName`, ascending subsort by `firstName`. Array can have as many items as you want. * `[{ lastName: -1 }, "firstName"]` - descending sort by `lastName`, ascending subsort by `firstName`. Mixed types are ok.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: sortBy

attribute.description:
Controls which column headers can trigger sorting by user clicks.
Acceptable values are:
* "auto" - (default) looks for `sortable: true` in the column configurations * `true` - all columns are enabled * `false - no UI sortable is enabled * {String[]} - array of key names to give sortable headers<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"auto"}-->
attribute.name: sortable

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->

attribute.description:
The View class used to render the `<table>` into the Widget's `contentBox`. This View can handle the entire table rendering itself or delegate to other Views.
It is not strictly necessary that the class function assigned here be a View subclass. It must however have a `render()` method.
When the DataTable is rendered, an instance of this View will be created and its `render()` method called. The View instance will be assigned to the DataTable instance's `view` property.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: Determine if the content starts as toggled on/off on page load.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: expanded

attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: Transition definitions such as duration and type of easing effect.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->
attribute.name: transition

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: toolbarLocale

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be autimatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: width

attribute.description:
The alignment configuration for this widget.
The `align` attribute is used to align a reference point on the widget, with the reference point on another `Node`, or the viewport. The object which `align` expects has the following properties:
* __`node`__: The `Node` to which the widget is to be aligned. If set to `null`, or not provided, the widget is aligned to the viewport.
* __`points`__: A two element Array, defining the two points on the widget and `Node`/viewport which are to be aligned. The first element is the point on the widget, and the second element is the point on the `Node`/viewport. Supported alignment points are defined as static properties on `WidgetPositionAlign`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: align

attribute.description:
An Array of Objects corresponding to the `Node`s and events that will cause the alignment of this widget to be synced to the DOM.
The `alignOn` Attribute is expected to be an Array of Objects with the following properties:
* __`eventName`__: The String event name to listen for.
* __`node`__: The optional `Node` that will fire the event, it can be a `Node` reference or a selector String. This will default to the widget's `boundingBox`.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: alignOn

attribute.description: The content to be added to the body section. This will replace any existing content in the body. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: tooltipBodyContent

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description:
A convenience Attribute, which can be used as a shortcut for the `align` Attribute.
If set to `true`, the widget is centered in the viewport. If set to a `Node` reference or valid selector String, the widget will be centered within the `Node`. If set to `false`, no center positioning is applied.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: centered

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->

attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: Determine the duration of the tooltip animation.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false,"defaultValue":"0.15"}-->
attribute.name: duration

attribute.description: The section (WidgetStdMod.HEADER, WidgetStdMod.BODY or WidgetStdMod.FOOTER) which should be resized to fill the height of the standard module, when a height is set on the Widget. If a height is not set on the widget, then all sections are sized based on their content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: fillHeight

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: The content to be added to the footer section. This will replace any existing content in the footer. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.
attribute.name: footerContent

attribute.description: Format the title attribute before set the content of the tooltip.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: formatter

attribute.description: The content to be added to the header section. This will replace any existing content in the header. If you want to append, or insert new content, use the setStdModContent method.

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description:
An array of objects corresponding to the nodes, events, and keycodes to hide the widget on. The implementer can supply an array of objects, with each object having the following properties:

eventName: (string, required): The eventName to listen to.

node: (Y.Node, optional): The Y.Node that will fire the event (defaults to the boundingBox of the widget)

keyCode: (string, optional): If listening for key events, specify the keyCode

By default, this attribute consists of one object which will cause the widget to hide if the escape key is pressed.
attribute.name: hideOn

attribute.description: Container to nest children nodes. If it has a container it's not a leaf.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: container

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: Determine if its going to be lazy loaded or not.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: lazyLoad

attribute.description: Determine if its going to be selected on toggle.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: selectOnToggle

attribute.description: Type of the treeview (i.e. could be 'file' or 'normal').<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"file"}-->
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: Array of children (i.e. could be a JSON metadata object or a TreeNode instance).<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false,"defaultValue":"[]"}-->
attribute.name: treeviewddChildren

attribute.description: Container to nest children nodes. If it has a container it's not a leaf.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: container

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: Determine if its going to be lazy loaded or not.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: lazyLoad

attribute.description: Delay of the scroll while dragging the TreeNodes.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"100"}-->
attribute.name: scrollDelay

attribute.description: Determine if its going to be selected on toggle.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: selectOnToggle

attribute.description: Type of the treeview (i.e. could be 'file' or 'normal').<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"file"}-->
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: IO options for the current TreeNode load the children.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->
attribute.name: io

attribute.description: Contains the list of supported directives according to Velocity specification.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.ArrayList","required":false}-->
attribute.name: directives

attribute.description: Contains the regular expression which checks for directive.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"/#[\\w]*[^#]*$/"}-->
attribute.name: directivesMatcher

attribute.description: he Editor in which the current instance is plugged.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false}-->
attribute.name: host

attribute.description: Contains the regular expression which will check for variable match.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"/\\$[\\w., ()\"]*(?:[^$]|\\\\\\$)*$/"}-->
attribute.name: variablesMatcher

attribute.description: The outermost DOM node for the Widget, used for sizing and positioning of a Widget as well as a containing element for any decorator elements used for skinning.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: boundingBox

attribute.description: A DOM node that is a direct descendant of a Widget's bounding box that houses its content.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: contentBox

attribute.description: CSS class to be automatically added to the boundingBox.
attribute.name: cssClass

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the destroy lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: destroyed

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget should be disabled. The disabled implementation is left to the specific classes extending widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if the Widget, or one of its descendants, has focus.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: focused

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the height of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: height

attribute.description: CSS class added to hide the boundingBox when visible is set to false.
attribute.name: hideClass

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this object has been through the init lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: initialized

attribute.description: The default locale for the widget. NOTE: Using get/set on the "strings" attribute will return/set strings for this locale.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false,"defaultValue":"en"}-->
attribute.name: videoLocale

attribute.description: URL (on .ogv format) used by Video to play.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: ogvUrl

attribute.description: If true the render phase will be automatically invoked preventing the .render() manual call.
attribute.name: render

attribute.description: Flag indicating whether or not this Widget has been through the render lifecycle phase.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The DOM node to parse for configuration values, passed to the Widget's HTML_PARSER definition<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: srcNode

attribute.description: Collection of strings used to label elements of the Widget's UI.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.util.HashMap","required":false,"defaultValue":"{}"}-->
attribute.name: strings

attribute.description: URL (on .swf format) used by Video to create a fallback player with Flash.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.String","outputType":"java.lang.String","required":false}-->
attribute.name: swfUrl

attribute.description: Number (between -32767 to 32767) indicating the widget's position in the default tab flow. The value is used to set the "tabIndex" attribute on the widget's bounding box. Negative values allow the widget to receive DOM focus programmatically (by calling the focus method), while being removed from the default tab flow. A value of null removes the "tabIndex" attribute from the widget's bounding box.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Number","required":false,"defaultValue":"null"}-->
attribute.name: tabIndex

attribute.description: Boolean indicating if use of the WAI-ARIA Roles and States should be enabled for the Widget.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"false"}-->
attribute.name: useARIA

attribute.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the Widget is visible.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"boolean","outputType":"boolean","required":false,"defaultValue":"true"}-->
attribute.name: visible

attribute.description: String with units, or number, representing the width of the Widget. If a number is provided, the default unit, defined by the Widgets DEF_UNIT, property is used.<!--{"event":false,"inputType":"java.lang.Object","outputType":"java.lang.Object","required":false}-->
attribute.name: width
